name: 2014_05_humanities_student_major_128_philosophy
title: 2014-05-humanities-student-major_128_philosophy.txt
content_scrubbed:
No but you just proved my point by missing it. 

Who cares? This is nice information to have, but it[.] not vital.

People who are getting priced out of their neighborhood care. And those people are overwhelmingly people of color. And the people pricing them out are overwhelmingly white and upper-middle to upper class. Things you would discover and research when you study the humanities. 

The free market economy? I don't understand what you're trying to get athere.

Same as above, among other things. The Free Market Economy hasn't been doing people of color any favors. 

Free market economy decides these things! Also, the people who are trained in the concept and usage of such things as energy consumption and engineering- aka, non-humanities_major.

I don't understand what you mean when you say Free Market Economy. You refer to it like it is a rational entity making decisions.

You are also ignoring the political and economic factors which affect decision making around energy solutions. We are currently in a climate crisis, but we are not moving to curb carbon emission quickly enough. Why isn't the Free Market Economy fixing tat? 

STEM fields can only show you how to build a solar farm, they cannot show you why more pipelines are being built instead. 

Wait, are you claiming that the entire Civil Rights Movement is because of humanities_major?

Um... no. When did I say that?
